title: Compiler panic when using a struct containing an option containing a closure

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Hello,

The following code makes the compiler panic:

``` rust
type baz<'r> = |a: &str|: 'r;

struct Foo<'a> {
    pub bar: Option<baz<'a>>,
}

fn main() {
    let foo = Foo {
        bar: Some(|_| {}), // No panic if set to `None`.
    };
}
```

The error is as follows:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
